description.en: In the course of Solid State Theory, the mathematical description of crystal structures, crystal lattice dynamics and the related properties of materials are considered. The quantum mechanical theory of electron states in solids is presented and the relevant electrical, magnetic and optical phenomena are modelled. The effects caused by electron-electron and electron-phonon interactions are also treated.
description.et: Tahkiseteooria kursuses käsitletakse kristallstruktuuride matemaatilist kirjeldamist, kristallvõre dünaamikat ja sellest tulenevaid ainete omadusi. Antakse ülevaade elektronseisundite kvantmehaanilisest teooriast tahkistes ning modelleeritakse vastavaid elektrilisi, magnetilisi ja optilisi nähtusi.  Samuti vaadeldakse elektron-elektron ja elektron-foonon interaktsioonidega seotud efekte.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give a systematic survey about the theoretical foundations of contemporary solid state physics.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda süstemaatiline ülevaade kaasaegse tahkisefüüsika teoreetilistest alustest.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, the student:
- knows the methods of the quantum statistics applied in the present course;
learning_outcomes.et: - valdab kursuse raames rakendatavaid kvantstatistika meetodeid;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the theoretical foundations of the description of crystal structures and the dynamics of crystal lattice;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb kristallstruktuuride kirjeldamise ja kristallvõre dünaamika teoreetilisi aluseid;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the principles of the description of electron states in crystals;
- understands the quantum-physical background of the electron and phonon properties of crystal;
learning_outcomes.et: - saab aru kristallide elektron- ja foononomaduste kvantfüüsikalisest taustast;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the foundations electron band theory;
- understands the role of electron-electron and electron-phonon interactions in crystals.
learning_outcomes.et: - saab aru elektron-elektron ja elektron-foonon interaktsiooni rollist kristallides.

grade_evaluation.et:
Suuline eksam koosneb kolmest komponendist:
1) vestlus koduste ülesannete alusel (40%)
2) vestlus ettevalmistatud eksamipileti alusel (30%)
3) üldised küsimused (põhimõisted ja kontseptsioonid) kogu loengukursuse ulatuses (30%)

debt_elimination.et: Eksami kordussooritus on võimalik üks kord enne semestri lõppu (kokkuleppel õppejõuga).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
1. N. W. Ashcroft, N. D. Mermin "Solid State Physics" (Thomson Learning, Inc., 1976).
2. M. T. Dove "Structure and Dynamics: An Atomic View of Materials" (Oxford University Press, 2003).
3. J. Singleton " Band Theory and Electronic Properties of Solids" (Oxford University Press, 2006).
4. Charles Kittel "Introduction to Solid State Physics" (John Wiley and Sons, 2004).
5. Charles Kittel "Quantum Theory of Solids" (John Wiley and Sons,1987).
6. H. Bruus, K. Flensberg " Many-Body Quantum Theory in Condensed Matter Physics: An Introduction" (Oxford University Press, 2004).
7. P. L. Taylor, O. Heinonen "A Quantum approach to Condensed Matter Physics" (Cambridge University Press, 2002).
8. O. Madelung "Introduction to Solid-State Theory " (Springer, 2007).
9. J. Ziman "Principles of the Theory of Solids" (Cambridge University Press, 1979).
10. J. Ziman "Electrons and Phonons: The Theory of Transport Phenomena in Solids" (Oxford University Press, 2001).
11. M. Fox "Optical Properties of Solids" (Oxford University Press, 2006).
12. S. Blundell "Magnetism in Condensed Matter" (Oxford University Press, 2006).
